subject: Season Two - First Look
event: My friends at HBO have just released some photos from the second season of GAME OF THRONES, scheduled to premiere on April 1. I thought I'd share them with you. Here's a first look at some of our new characters, LORD REAPER OF PYKE Balon Greyjoy played by Patrick Malahide-Helen Sloan/HBO THE MAID OF TARTH Brienne played by Gwendoline Christie-Helen Sloan/HBO THE ONION KNIGHT Davos Seaworth played by Liam Cunningham- Helen Sloan/HBO More to come...

comments.article: Especially love Gwendoline Christie as Brienne. She looks fabulous. I'll admit I did not picture Davos that way at all (more Inigo Montoya from the Princess Bride) but I can go with it. Looking forward to season 2 with great excitement!
comments.subject: Excellent - thank you for sharing!

comments.article: Same thing here. Not that I don't like Davos' TV version, mind you, but so far he is one of the most different characters from what I pictured from the books.
comments.subject: Re: Excellent - thank you for sharing!

comments.article: Nice! Brienne and Davos are looking quite grand:)

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article: Ooooh! Excited about Brienne!
I really like Brienne, I just hope she's tall.
Gwendoline Christie (the actress) is 6'3". No worries there.

Brienne looks better than I thought...

thank you!
i am sooooo ready for april! brianne looks fab. davos is amazing. balon looks just like i pictured him

comments.upictitle: in other words: asoif. bran glance
comments.article: Ohhh, the Onion Knight. Perfect perfect perfect. I'm chuffed.
BRIENNE! She looks awesome!

Heh. I know that after the announcement, people were worried that Gwendoline Christie was "too pretty" to play Brienne.

I think it's safe to say that the makeup folks are due for another Emmy nomination here.
Am I the only one who doesn't think Brienne looks that ugly here?

I was skeptical about the Brienne casting, since I thought the actress was way too pretty. I was hoping for a Charlize Theron/Monster treatment, but I wasn't sure it was gonna happen.

Glad to see I was wrong. Brienne looks perfect! (Well, she doesn't have the large blue eyes, but only a supreme nerd would rage at that. ;)

Those are great pics posted so far. I hope we'll see Jaqen soon!
comments.subject: Brienne, WOW

comments.article:
I must say you have chosen Brienne very very well! She is just like I imagined her, perfect! And Davos Seaworth (by the way, I love his name) is also as I imagined him (except that the fingers missing are in the wrong hand :P)
The only actor that is not as I imagined him is Patrick Malahide, as Balon Greyjoy. I pictured Balon in a completely different way. Yet, if Patrick plays his part well, I will be happy! :)

When I saw that pic of Gwendoline Christie as Brienne I actually said "holy fuck" out loud.

I CANNOT BELIEVE how accurate the casting is! BRAVO!

comments.upictitle: Идеи подарков от коллективного разума: pic#119965809
comments.article: Oh Brienne is good!
Brienne is perfect.

Am I the only one who doesn't believe that Brienne (the character, not Gwendoline Christie) isn't actually ugly? I imagine she is a handsome butch girl...but so far out of the beauty standards that no one can see her beauty...also because of that she is awkward and without a lot self-confidence...which doesn't help.
Brienne looks pretty cool, I imagined her slightly different (isn't that always the way w/ adaptions tho?) and I imagined Davos about 20 years younger, in appearance. Nevertheless, awesome!
BRIENNE! Can't wait!!

Mr. Martin, I have to tell you, when you announced the casting of Brienne, I flinched internally, because while *your* Brienne is such a fully realized, living breathing creation, casting her with a real life actress seemed so difficult.

Ms. Cristie looks awesome all scrubbed down and armored up. Huzzah!
comments.subject: Brienne FTW!

comments.article:
Oh my seven hells!

"A Beauty! A Beauty!"

Guess they did away with the Rainbow Guard, but otherwise, perfect.

comments.upictitle: chris: say hello to my little friend
comments.article:
my guess is that this still is a costume from after Cat spirits her away and garbs her.

but damn, she's an amazing fit. that picture is priceless; the expression alone...
OH MY GOD, BRIENNE!
THE ONION KNIGHT \o/
Mr Martin so glad that this whole series of shots especially Brienne and Mel capture your amazing description of these wonderful characters. Role on S2.
Was not sure how Brienne played by Gwendoline Christie-Helen Sloan was going to come off, but I see it now.  Good make up!
comments.subject: Can see the depiction now

comments.article: Good Goddess. Brienne looks E.X.A.C.T.L.Y how I imagined her. You must be very excited, George.

comments.upictitle: stone biscuit productions: sport for our neighbors
comments.article: BRIENNE. YES MA'AM.
